controller

Class GameHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • controller.GameHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class GameHandler
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Class for keeping a game between two client(handler)s.
    Version:
    v1.0
    Author:
    Jan-Jaap van Raffe and Wouter Bos

      The Client(handler)s.

      Index of the current player.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameHandler

        public GameHandler(ClientHandler p1,
                   ClientHandler p2)
        Creates a new LocalGame object.
        Parameters:
        p1 - name of first ClientHandler (player one)
        p2 - name of first ClientHandler (player one)

    • Method Detail

      • getBoard

        public Board getBoard()
        Returns the board.
        Returns:
        board

      • getCurrent

        public int getCurrent()
        Returns the current player as integer.
        Returns:
        integer of current player

      • run

        public void run()
        Plays the Connect Four game. First the handlers will send a Game-Start message to the clients. Then player one will be asked for a move.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • checkMove

        boolean checkMove(java.lang.String message)
        Checks if the move send by a client is a valid move.
        Parameters:
        message - Move command send by the client
        Returns:
        true if it is a valid move

      • disconnect

        void disconnect(java.lang.String client)
        Handles an in game client who disconnects. Lets the other client win and sends a message to that client.
        Parameters:
        client - name of disconnected client

      • move

        void move(java.lang.String message)
        Does the move given by the client(handler). Checks if there is a winner. If so, sends a Game-End message to both client(handler)s. If not, asks the other client for a move.
        Parameters:
        message - the move message from the client

      • determineMove

        int determineMove(java.lang.String message)
        Gets the actual move as an integer out of the move-command send by the client. Returns -1 if the command is from the wrong client.
        Parameters:
        message - the move-command send by the client
        Returns:
        the move as integer
